OctaDist

A tool for calculating distortion parameters in coordination complexes.

View the Project on GitHub OctaDist/OctaDist.github.io

OctaDist

OctaDist (Octahedral Distortion calculator) is an inorganic chemistry and crystallography program for computing the distortion parameters, such as distance and angle distortions, in coordination complexes. For example, they are used for tracking the structural change of the spin-crossover complex when the electronics spin-state changes from low-spin to high-spin, and vice versa. OctaDist can also be used to study other kinds of metal complex such as perovskite and metal-organic framework (MOF).
